## Electrical conductivity

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="53%"}
![Resistor](pics/resistor.png)

* length $L$, cross-section area $A$
* voltage $U$ [V], current $I$ [A]
* Ohmic resistance $R$=$U$/$I$ [$\Omega$]
:::
::: {.column width="47%"}

:::{.fragment}
* current density $j$=$I$/$A$ [A/m²]
* electric field $E$=$U$/$L$ [V/m]
:::
:::{.fragment}
* **Ohm's law**<br>
$j=\sigma E$ (conductivity $\sigma$ [A/Vm])
$\Rightarrow$ resistivity $\rho=1/\sigma=E/j$ [$\Omega$m]
:::
:::{.fragment}
$\Rightarrow \rho = \frac{U/L}{I/A}=\frac{U}{I}\frac{A}{L}=R\cdot k$
geometric factor $k$ [m]
:::
:::
::::

## 4-point measurement (Knödel, 2005)

![](pics/knoedelDE.png){fig-align="center"}

## Geometric factor

$U_{AM} = \rho I \frac{1}{4\pi \overline{AM}}$, $U_{AN} = \rho I \frac{1}{4\pi \overline{AN}}$ etc.

$$ \Delta U = U_{AM} - U_{AN} - (U_{BM} - U_{BN}) $$

$$ \Delta U = \rho I \big( \frac{1}{4\pi \overline{AM}} - \frac{1}{4\pi \overline{AN}} - \frac{1}{4\pi \overline{BM}} + \frac{1}{4\pi \overline{BN}}\big)$$

$$ \Rightarrow \rho = \frac{\Delta U}{I} k \quad\mbox{with}\quad k = \frac{4\pi}{\frac{1}{\overline{AM}}-\frac{1}{\overline{AN}}-\frac{1}{\overline{BM}}+\frac{1}{\overline{BN}}} $$



## Experiment

* Waterfilled horizontal borehole (approx. 9.5 m length)
* Borehole probe with four ring electrodes

![Construction of borehole probe](pics/sonde_en.svg){width="150%"}

* Measurement of resistances $R$ for different depths & different arrays (combinations of current & potential electrodes) $\rightarrow$ $\rho_s=Rk$
